column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Regulation signs normally are:
2. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
3. Warning signs are normally:
4. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only on the left and right side

column2: 5. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
6. Large trucks:
column4: do not need more room to maneuver.
column6: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.

column2: 7. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 8. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
9. This road sign means:
10. This road sign means:
column6: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column8: Don’t park next to the traffic signal

column2: 11. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 12. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 13. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 16. Before backing up, you should:
column6: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column10: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 17. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 18. A red flashing signal means the same as a:
19. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column10: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 20. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
21. These are:
22. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 23. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 24. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 25. A flashing yellow light means:
26. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
column6: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.
column8: know that you should avoid this bad habit.

column2: 27. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
28. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 29. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 30. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 31. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column6: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.
column8: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
33. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
34. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 35. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 36. When turning or changing lanes, drivers must:
column4: signal only when driving in traffic at night.
column6: signal only when driving at night.
column8: always signal their intentions even when there are no vehicles.
column10: signal only if there is traffic.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column10: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 38. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
39. When passing a motorcycle, you must:
column4: have your vehicle entirely into the left lane before and during the pass.
column6: honk your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: speed up above the speed limit and use your emergency lights to alert the motorcyle that you are about to pass.

column2: 40. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
